title: Can't use Snapdrop.net
content:
Website: https://snapdrop.net/

Problem: I cannot send and receive files on this site using the PC version of Firefox, even in private browsing mode. But firefox android client is working fine. This site claims that it uses WebRTC technology, so I guess that maybe Firefox is blocked my request for security reasons. And I also turn off ad-block addons, but it still not working.

It's a very simple and beautiful tool so it would be a great pity if you could not use it. So let's fix it!
creator: weiyichen

title: disappearing screenshot button
content: When I upgraded to Firefox 83, I discovered that the screenshot function, which previously appeared with a simple right click, had disappeared. I did some reading, and have tried the 'page actions' drop-down' menu, and the 'about:config' modification, but neither, frankly, did a thing. So, what gives? And why me? instead of, say, you? And, oh yeah, a solution would be cool, too...

title: logins/passwords
content:
I'm so incredibly dumb. I downloaded cleanmymac to free up space so I could update to Big Sur. Stupid idea cause I don't have enough space anyway and now I've lost half my saved passwords on Firefox.

I was able to recover about half by reading some articles here about the old firefox data and copying logins.json and key3 and 4 or whatever the directions were.

So is there any hope to get the rest back? I'm not 100% computer savy so this might be stupid ?, but are they on the "keychain" somewhere? Should I be asking this question on cleanmymac website?

I wish I had something to save backups to so I could just use the time machine or something, but I don't have anything external to save on. I will definitely get something to hopefully prevent this in the future.

Thanks so much for all the knowledgeable users here that provide much appreciated help!
creator: lrsfrog

title: When I click on a Internet shortcut or a link in an E-mail a new instance of Firefox opens
content:

The shortcut can be on the Desktop or in a folder.
creator: ztruker

title: Firefox can't find CDC.gov site. Works fine in Safari
content:
I have been trying all day to access the Centers for Disease Control website at cdc.gov. Firefox (83.0/Mac) just says it can't contact the server. I used Network Utility to look up the IP address of the site, which reported 198.246.102.49. I entered that address into Firefox and it refused to go there, saying it was a potential security risk.

So I tried Safari (14.0.1), and cdc.gov loads immediately with no problems.

What the heck?
creator: GRobLewis

title: Screen scaling too large
content:
Hi, My web page scaling is too large. they are so large that most of the webpage are very difficult to use as only a fraction of the screen shows. Using the 2 finger on the keypad, I can increase the scaling making the page even larger but when trying too reduce the scaling it stops at the original setting. I cannot shrink it further. I tried on different browser and I do not have that issue. Never noticed it before because I usually work with external 4K monitor and the increase scaling in that case is almost mandatory. Tonight i am working on my laptop(Asus Zenbook 14) without external screens and no mouse. Attached is the screenshot of this page. I cannot make it smaller. Any parameter/trick to resolve this issue?

JMarc
creator: JMarc61

title: Suppress auto printing
content: Apparently it is possible to write a web page such that it pops up the printer dialogue on load. That is, something in the page automatically launches the print dialogue. Usually that is wanted/expected behavior. For example, you just clicked on a "Print" button on the page. In my case, there is one page I use a lot that tries to auto-print a PDF. But I have PDF's set to open outside of FireFox. So the PDF loads in Acrobat (expected behavior), and FireFox tries to print the HTML page that is open in FireFox. Also presumably expected behavior, but not wanted if it is the PDF I want to print. This has gotten annoying, and so I'm looking for a control that suppresses printing. Ten minutes of googleing and all I can find are articles for the control to suppress the dialogue for printing, and instead print directly to the default printer, ie silent printing. I don't want to suppress the dialog. I want to auto-cancel the print job. That is, I want to disallow a web page from invoking the print dialog at all, by overriding the print instruction. Such as setting could either be set for a specific page, set or globally; either would work for me. Is there a control for that?
creator: daniel164

title: Google Translate website

So, I'm wondering, what happened in between the major updates (2019 to 2020) that cause this issue?

title: Al cerrar el navegador o la página web, Firefox me cierra sesión automáticamente ¿cómo puedo evitar esto?
content: Hola Esto es muy raro y no pasaba antes. Si tengo abierto el Facebook y estoy logueado, puedo navegar sin problemas, pero al cerrar la pestaña o cerrar el navegador, si Facebook se cierra al abrirlo otra vez me pide la contraseña de acceso, es decir, me cierra la sesión automáticamente sin haberla cerrado yo. Esto me pasa con Facebook, Twitter, Instagram y con Linkedin. Es muy molesto tener que ir logueandome cada vez que cierro una pestaña, es más, me pasa hasta con Google, porque algunas veces al cerrar la pestaña de Google, si vuelvo a entrar en Google me pide otra vez que acepte los términos de acuerdo de Google. ¿Cómo puedo evitar esto, es la primera vez que me pasa una cosa así desde que uso Firefox? Saludos
creator: mrmister23
